intro: Trigonotis longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Trigonotis longipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Its growth habit includes both herbaceous and semi-woody stems, depending on environmental conditions.
